intro: Conophytum pole-evansii, commonly known as the "Cape snowball," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical or spherical stems that store water. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers during the winter months, which are borne on short, hairy stalks. Its leaves are usually reduced to spines, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Conophytum pole-evansii is a popular choice for rock gardens and xerophytic collections due to its ornamental appearance and low maintenance requirements.
